byline.contributor: Serge F. Kovaleski reported from Baltimore, and Michael Wines from New York. Richard A. Oppel Jr. contributed reporting from Baltimore. Elisa Cho and Alain Delaquérière contributed research.
byline.original: By SERGE F. KOVALESKI and MICHAEL WINES

abstract: Lawyers for six Baltimore police officers charged in the death of Freddie Gray intend to challenge basic facts of case, arguing that they acted in accordance with letter of the law and that Gray's death was tragic accident.
lead_paragraph: Counsel for the six charged in relation to Freddie Gray’s arrest and death say the facts of the case do not support the allegations.

headline.main: Baltimore Officers Plan to Challenge Prosecutor’s Basic Accusation
headline.print_headline: Baltimore Officers Plan to Challenge Prosecutor’s Basic Accusation

snippet: Counsel for the six charged in relation to Freddie Gray’s arrest and death say the facts of the case do not support the allegations.
